definition: to ask a question, already knowing the answer
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
to know/to be aware
happening/instance/reason/cause/intentional/former/old/friend/therefore/hence/(of people) to die, dead
to ask

sentences.english: My bad temper, you asks, but already knows.
sentences.chinese: 我的坏脾气，你明知故问。

sentences.english: I asked, knowing full well what he meant.
Your mother turns around and asks "What are you doing?"
sentences.chinese: 明知故问都应该有用意，而此时的用意是什么？

definition: (literary) to sneer/to laugh at
like a smile yet not a smile (idiom)
overtones in conversation/things indirectly implied from what is said
to cast sidelong glances at sb
to ask (a question) in reply/to answer a question with a question/rhetorical question
to put on a fake smile (idiom)/to smile insincerely
displeased/annoyed
to frown
suspicious/in doubt
to laugh involuntarily/Taiwan pr. [e4 ran2 shi1 xiao4]
to laugh in spite of oneself/to be unable to help laughing/to break into laughter
to have hidden meaning/implication/more than just the apparent meaning/something hinted
how can one be sure?
inwardly angry/indignant/sulking/sullen
smiling/with a smile
(coll.) teasing/mischievous
